body.p: An Agavi application directory is structured according to Agavi's conventions. The Agavi project configuration system knows about the layout and its commands create or modify files and directories inside the source tree.

An application's pub/ directory is the document root for your Web server: it contains static resources such as CSS files, javascript source, images and other items that are reachable through the Web server but do not involve invocation of the application.
The application itself—configuration, temporary and cache directories, libraries and source files—are located in app/.

ul.li: The high-level Modules and their corresponding contents are located in app/modules/.
The global configuration can be found in app/config/. (You will examine it in greater detail in the next section of this chapter.)
The app/models/ directory contains the global Models for your application.

In a similar fashion, the app/templates/ directory contains the global templates for the application. Typically, this directory contains templates that are used in all application output: wrappers (called decorators), headers and footers, and so forth.
Third party libraries are placed in app/lib/. Agavi is very extensible and can cooperate with virtually any foreign code.
